question: Extract the text in the image
hpto1.3_resp:
Sample Editorial 
Cell Phones In Our Schools 
When you were a kid you ever have to call your mother and the school wouldn't let 
you? Kids today still have to call their mothers sometimes! But they won't let them. 
Schools have become much more strict about the phones even in an emergency 
sometimes. So where's why it would be a great thing if schools would use cell phones in 
school. 
Cell phones have been an issue in schools forever since we became a bug thing amongst teenagers. Sixth grader Amber H., says, "There could be an emergency that no one knew 
about until someone tried to reach her on the phone!" In fact of school leaders make it for 
They take students cell phones when they aren't using them and they are turned off and hidden so that they don't disturb anybody. Teachers shouldn't be allowed to take cell phones 
when they aren't being bothered anywhere else but put on silent and they are hidden from other classmates.Just two years ago in October a girl took the case to the Supreme Court.She had 
had her cell phone taken away. I was at her backpack turned off and disturbing anyone when 
the teacher saw it and took it away and she never had it returned to her! 
"I wasn't even suing it and the teacher saw it my backpack and confiscated it" I tried 
to explain that I had to have it for later that day when my practice was over but he wouldn't listen." She says bring their cell phones to school for reasons like that only because it's 
later teacher confiscate it. 
Imagine this... You live in lower Manhattan and your child goes to school nearby. It's September 11th,2001. You are working quietly and suddenly hear a loud bang and look out 
your window. Suddenly there is panic everywhere then all the teachers yell fire alarm! A year passes by and you haven't heard anything yet. Have you ever wondered what happened? 
Have been alerted. Suddenly the intercom comes and the principal's voice blares over the 
speaker," Students, get out your cell phones and call your parents immediately". They could use 
the speech phones but not only is there a line to use the phones the first person finds out the 
intercom system has failed and can't dial any numbers except those that say police or ambulance 
but to many students using five or six cell phones wouldn't think that the battery would die 
out? How would a child reach their parents to tell them that they are ok?" They cannot! 
In emergencies like this its very important to have a way for a child to reach their parents! 
Sixth grader Emily W. says, "We need them to school because if there was an emergency and we couldn't see the school (phones) for one reason or another we would pull our own phones' 
Workshop & Beasley    Write in the Middle

Statement of Academic Integrity 
I hereby acknowledge that the thesis submitted is a product of my own independent research under the supervision of my supervisor, and that all the data, statistics, pictures and materials are reliable and trustworthy,,and that all the previous research and sources are appropriately marked in the thesis, and that the intellectual property of the thesis belongs to the school. I am fully aware of the legal effect of this statement.
Student Signature: Zeng kaixiang Date: 2020.3.28

question: Extract the text in the image
hpto1.3_resp: [ABSTRACT] Incomplete information game (IIG) exists widely in real life, such as military resources allocation, commercial competition, social governance and so on. Because of the reward feedback in the game process, reinforcement learning (RL) is a promising technique for solving such complex problems. Meanwhile, it is critical to obtain valuable information by analyzing opponent's behaviors. Based on uncertainty modeling in IIG, this thesis proposes an RL algorithm with opponent models, in order to respond adaptively to different types of opponents. Theoretically, this thesis proposes three methods to measure uncertainty in IIG: utility fluctuation method, regret value method, and information entropy method, which will be applied to th proposed uncertainty-based RL algorithm.Multiple combinations of opponent models & decision networks are also applied to target different types of opponents. More specifically, three model selection methods are proposed: threshold scheduling method, learning scheduling method,and analysis scheduling method. In order to fully consider the uncertainty, this thesis innovatively adopts the Q-Learning algorithm based on the uncertainty in the decision network. A set of sub-networks for modelling opponents and model selection methods finally constitute the uncertaint- based RL algorithm with opponent models in this thesis.

question: describe the piicture
hpto1.3_resp:
The image captures a single, vibrant pink lotus flower in full bloom. The flower is the central focus of the image, with its six delicate petals surrounding a bright yellow center that radiates light from within. Each petal curves gently outwards, creating an intricate pattern around the core.

The background is awash with dark green hues, providing a stark contrast to the striking color of the lotus. This backdrop appears blurred and out of focus, further emphasizing the sharp details of the flower itself. Despite this, one can discern the presence of other leaves or stems beneath the main subject, suggesting it's part of a larger plant structure.

There are no discernible texts or human-made objects in the image, reinforcing the sense of being deep within nature. The relative position of the flower suggests it was photographed at eye level, allowing for a clear view of both the top and bottom parts of the blossom. There are no actions taking place; instead, the image conveys a stillness, as if capturing a quiet moment on a serene pond surface. 

Overall, the image presents a detailed snapshot of a blooming lotus, highlighting not only the beauty of individual flowers but also their role within a broader ecosystem.

question: Describe the photo
hpto1.3_resp:
The image captures a scene in an urban setting, where the main focus is on a small white electric car. The car's design is compact and futuristic, with a black roof contrasting against its predominantly white body. The car is parked diagonally within a parking lot made of gray concrete tiles. It faces towards the left side of the frame, giving us a clear view of its profile from the right rear angle. 

In the background, there are several other cars parked at various angles around the lot. These vehicles add depth to the scene but do not detract from the prominence of the white electric car as it stands out due to its size and color contrast.

question: Describe the photo
hpto1.3_resp:
The image captures a scene of urban abandonment. Dominating the frame is an old bicycle, its once vibrant colors now faded and rusted from years of neglect. The bike leans against a concrete staircase, as if seeking support in its solitude. Its front wheel has succumbed to time, lying flat on the ground while the back wheel clings precariously to the step.

A chain, perhaps once used for movement or transport, hangs loosely around one part of the bike. A sign that reads "DIAMO BACK" is affixed somewhere within view, though its meaning remains unclear without further context.

In the background, everyday life continues unperturbed by this relic of times past. A trash can stands at attention nearby, ready to serve its purpose. Further back, a building looms, silent witness to the passage of time encapsulated in the form of this abandoned bicycle.

The man at the center of this formation holds up two fingers, possibly signaling a victory or celebration. His stance suggests he might be the leader or captain of the team. On the far left, a third member of the team kneels down, adding variety to the otherwise standing arrangement. Their collective presence paints a picture of camaraderie and teamwork, essential elements in any sports endeavor. question: describe the image
hpto1.3_resp:
The image is a captivating oil painting that captures the essence of still life. The central focus is on a jar of jam and a basket filled with peaches, both resting on a wooden table against a dark background. The area of ​​each small square is 1cm^2, so what is the area of ​​triangle ABC?
hpto1.3_resp:
The area of a triangle is half the product of its base and height. In this case, we can use the side PQ as our base (since it's horizontal) and the vertical distance from P to C as our height.

So if PQ = 4cm, then BC = 2cm (half of 4). The area of ABC would be:

(1/2)(PQ)(BC) = (1/2)(4)(2) = 4 square centimeters

To find the point that divides line AB into a ratio of 3:2 starting from A, we can set up a proportion:

(18-4) / x = 3/2

Solving for x gives us:

x = ((18 - 4) * 2) / 3
x = (14 * 2) / 3
x = 28 / 3

So the point dividing line AB in this way has coordinates (28/3, 46).
